title: System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException when spawning a new terminal with CMake Tools extension in VSCode 1.104
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: N/A

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.104.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 10.0.19041.4522 (WinBuild.160101.0800)

Steps to Reproduce:

Update 1.104(.1) introduced a bug with Microsoft's CMake tools extension, and now clicking the "run" button launches a new terminal, and the following error message appears before the program is launched:
(Sorry for the French language)
```
Oups, un problème s'est produit. Signalez ce bogue avec les détails ci-dessous.
Signaler sur GitHub : https://github.com/lzybkr/PSReadLine/issues/new
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Dernières 5 touches :
 . " C : /

Exception :
System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException: La valeur doit être supérieure ou égale à zéro et inférieure à la taille de la mémoire tampon de la console dans cette dimension.
Nom du paramètre : left
La valeur réelle était -2.
   à Microsoft.PowerShell.PSConsoleReadLine.ReallyRender(RenderData renderData, String defaultColor)
   à Microsoft.PowerShell.PSConsoleReadLine.ForceRender()
   à Microsoft.PowerShell.PSConsoleReadLine.Insert(Char c)
   à Microsoft.PowerShell.PSConsoleReadLine.SelfInsert(Nullable`1 key, Object arg)
   à Microsoft.PowerShell.PSConsoleReadLine.ProcessOneKey(ConsoleKeyInfo key, Dictionary`2 dispatchTable, Boolean ignoreIfNoAction, Object arg)
   à Microsoft.PowerShell.PSConsoleReadLine.InputLoop()
   à Microsoft.PowerShell.PSConsoleReadLine.ReadLine(Runspace runspace, EngineIntrinsics engineIntrinsics)
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
PS C:\Users\User\Dropbox\Dev\CeDImu\build\Release> ."C:/Users/User/Dropbox/Dev/CeDImu/build/Release/CeDImu.exe"
```
The program launches fine and does not appear in subsequent runs, only when spawing the powershell terminal.

Now I do not know if this is the right place to report, please redirect me to where the issue should be reported.
I did not reported to the PSReadLine repo because their pinned issue said the bug has been fixed for years now, but it only appeared now with the VSCode update. Below are the powershell parameters information:
```
PS Version: 5.1.19041.6328
PS HostName: ConsoleHost
PSReadLine Version: 2.0.0-beta2
PSReadLine EditMode: Windows
OS: 10.0.19041.4522 (WinBuild.160101.0800)
BufferWidth: 125
BufferHeight: 12
```

title: Terminal Sticky Scrolling hides the most important lines
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
Version: 1.104.0 (Universal)
Commit: f220831ea2d946c0dcb0f3eaa480eb435a2c1260
Date: 2025-09-10T06:46:18.035Z
Electron: 37.3.1
ElectronBuildId: 12342881
Chromium: 138.0.7204.235
Node.js: 22.18.0
V8: 13.8.258.31-electron.0
OS: Darwin arm64 25.0.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add an alias to your git config: 

```
[alias]
        lg = log --color --graph --pretty=format:'%Cred%h%Creset -%C(yellow)%d%Creset %s %Cgreen(%cr)%Creset %C(bold blue)<%an>%Creset' --abbrev-commit
```
2. Enable Terminal > Sticky Scrolling
3. cd to your favorite source code folder
4. run `git lg` in your folder

Expected:
* The first line of output (the latest commit) is visible

Actual:
* The first line is hidden until you scroll up

title: Codespace Loading Issue
body:
Hi Codespace Support Team,

I'm writing to report a problem I'm having with my Codespace. When I try to open it, it gets stuck on the loading screen and never starts.

I've already tried:

Refreshing the page.

Closing and reopening my browser.

Trying a different browser.

The issue is still happening. Could you please check if there's a problem with my Codespace or with the service in general?

Thanks for your help.

Best regards,

title: Fix timeout in German language pack smoke test with improved retry logic
body:
The German localization smoke test was failing with a timeout error when waiting for the uninstall button to appear after installing the `ms-ceintl.vscode-language-pack-de` extension:

```
Error: Timeout: get element '.extension-editor .monaco-action-bar .action-item:not(.disabled) .extension-action.uninstall' after 20 seconds.
```

Language pack extensions have unique installation characteristics that can cause longer processing times:
- Network requests for language resource files
- Special localization processing during installation
- Extension editor loading complexity for language pack manifests
- Potential race conditions between installation completion and UI readiness

This change enhances the extension installation automation in `test/automation/src/extensions.ts` with:

**Improved timeout handling:**
- Extended individual element wait timeout from ~20s to ~30s (300 retries)
- Increased retry attempts from 3 to 6 for installation verification
- Added strategic wait periods between retry scenarios

**Better error detection and reporting:**
- Detection of ongoing installation state vs. UI loading issues
- Detection of extension editor load failures
- Specific error messages for different failure modes
- Enhanced progress logging for debugging

**Resilient retry strategy:**
- 5-second wait when extension is still installing
- 2-second wait between uninstall button search attempts  
- 3-second wait between installation retry attempts
- Maximum total wait time of ~3.5 minutes (reasonable for CI environments)

The changes are backward compatible and benefit all extension installation tests, making them more resilient to timing issues while providing better diagnostic information for failures.

Fixes #267290.

title: Fix extension action CSS selectors in smoke tests
body:
The smoke test for localization was failing with a timeout error when trying to locate the uninstall button after installing the German language pack extension:

```
Error: Timeout: get element '.extension-editor .monaco-action-bar .action-item:not(.disabled) .extension-action.uninstall' after 20 seconds.
```

The issue was that the CSS selectors in the test automation didn't match the actual DOM structure generated by the extension actions. The extension actions use more specific CSS classes than the selectors were targeting:

- **UninstallAction** generates class: `extension-action label uninstall`
- **InstallAction** generates class: `extension-action label prominent install`

But the smoke tests were looking for:
- `.extension-action.uninstall` (missing the `.label` class)
- `.extension-action.install` (missing the `.label.prominent` classes)

This fix updates the selectors in `test/automation/src/extensions.ts` to match the actual DOM structure:
- Uninstall button: `.extension-action.uninstall` → `.extension-action.label.uninstall`
- Install button: `.extension-action.install` → `.extension-action.label.prominent.install`

The selectors now correctly target the extension action buttons, allowing the smoke tests to find and interact with them as expected.

Fixes #267275.

title: SSH From Air-Gapped Machine - Missing vscode-cli file
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->

<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.87.2
- OS Version: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.6 (Plow) 64-bit
- GNOME Version: 40.4.0

I am trying to properly set up Remote Tunnel - SSH to work on my machine with limited internet access (basically airgapped). I was able to download a copy of vscode-server-linux-x64‑863d2581ecda6849923a22118d93a088b0745d9d6.tar.gz and extract it to `~/.vscode-server/bin/863d2581ecda6849923a22118d93a088b0745d9d6`. The window launches and I am able to edit code.

The output shows the following on launch:
```
...
> Trigger local server download
> b049262deb5e:trigger_server_download
> artifact==cli-alpine-x64==
> destFolder==/home/myuser/.vscode-server==
> destFolder2==/vscode-cli-863d2581ecda6849923a22118d93a088b0745d9d6.tar.gz==
> b049262deb5e:trigger_server_download_end
> Waiting for client to transfer server archive
> Waiting for /home/myuser/.vscode-server/vscode-cli-863d2581ecda6849923a22118d93a088b0745d9d6.tar.gz.done and vscode-server.tar.gz to exist
>
[13:14:19.330] Got request to download on client for {"artifact":"cli-alpine-x64", "destPath":"/home/myuser/.vscode-server/vscode-cli-863d2581ecda6849923a22118d93a088b0745d9d6.tar.gz"}
[13:14:19.330] Downloading VS Code server locally...
[13:14:19.550] Terminating local server
[13:14:19.551] Exec server for ssh-remote+mymachine failed: Error: Failed to download VS Code Server (XHR failed)
[13:14:19.551] Error opening exec server for ssh-remote+mymachine failed: Error: Failed to download VS Code Server (XHR failed)
[13:14:19.565] Local server exit: 15
```

I have noticed that `/.vscode-server/vscode-cli-863d2581ecda6849923a22118d93a088b0745d9d6.tar.gz` is created automatically, but it is 0 bytes. Is there a way to generate this file some other way? Or somewhere to download it from?

title: AI LLM Offline model support

labels.name: *duplicate
labels.description: Issue identified as a duplicate of another issue(s)

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

Feature 1:
Would it be possible to support local Open Source solution like LM Studio that expose an API to access LLM models offline?  (It is better than Ollama, because it integrate MLX support for Apple Silicon and other optimizations, as well as support GPU and more.) 

UX Improvement:
AI LLM is still confusing to integrate with external agent tools and MCP. 
There's need to abstract the technical integration of LLM and MCP, to make it intuitive and straight forward. (Not required to understand the under-layer)

title: Integrate Built-in Web Search into GitHub Copilot

labels.name: *duplicate
labels.description: Issue identified as a duplicate of another issue(s)

body: Type: Feature Request GitHub Copilot's web search currently depends on third-party APIs, requiring users to configure API keys, which introduces complexity and security risks. Many coding agents now offer built-in web search without external dependencies. Adding native web search would simplify the experience, remove configuration barriers, and improve Copilot's integration for better usability. VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.105.0-insider (7de43ea56b9b4bfd193263f7523ab7ad9d998d26, 2025-09-17T05:04:23.850Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 Modes:

title: Introduce Inline Model Override for GitHub Copilot Chat Sessions
body: Type: Feature Request Currently, switching models in GitHub Copilot chat requires changing the dropdown selection, which can be forgotten after use, leading to unintended consumption of premium models. A feature to temporarily select a model using syntax like "@model-name" in a single message would allow users to handle complex queries without modifying the session's default. VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.105.0-insider (7de43ea56b9b4bfd193263f7523ab7ad9d998d26, 2025-09-17T05:04:23.850Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 Modes:

title: Allow Temporary Model Selection in GitHub Copilot Chat via @ Commands
body: Type: Feature Request In GitHub Copilot chat, users must change the default model via dropdown, risking forgetting to switch back and wasting premium model usage. Introduce a temporary override like "@model-name" for single conversation turns without altering the session default. VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.105.0-insider (7de43ea56b9b4bfd193263f7523ab7ad9d998d26, 2025-09-17T05:04:23.850Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 Modes:

1. Look at sample telemetry for copilot agent mode, view the Properties.prompttypes field
2. Observe that it always has lengths after the colon of 1 or 2, which represent the number of items in the message content array, not the number of characters.

It appears that this line in chatParticipantTelemetry.ts (https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-chat/blob/3019b76c53c07b784a15277d0578a3b9238e4494/src/extension/prompt/node/chatParticipantTelemetry.ts#L612) should use getTextPart (https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-chat/blob/3019b76c53c07b784a15277d0578a3b9238e4494/src/platform/chat/common/globalStringUtils.ts#L13) and extract the length from that result like so:

```promptTypes: this._messages.map(msg => `${msg.role}${'name' in msg && msg.name ? `-${msg.name}` : ''}:${getTextPart(msg.content).length}`).join(','),```

title: Add `git branch` to default auto-approved terminal commands
body:
Fixes issue where `git branch` commands required manual approval in chat agent terminal tools despite being a safe, read-only operation.

## Problem

When using VS Code's chat agent terminal tools, the `git branch` command was not included in the default auto-approved commands list, forcing users to manually approve this safe operation every time. This created unnecessary friction for a commonly-used, read-only git command that poses no security risk.

## Solution

Added `'git branch': true` to the default auto-approved commands configuration alongside other safe git commands like `git status`, `git log`, `git show`, and `git diff`.

The `git branch` command is safe for auto-approval because:
- It's a read-only operation that only displays existing branch information
- It cannot modify the repository state or execute arbitrary code
- It's commonly used and expected to be as safe as other approved git commands
- It matches the requested regex pattern `/^git branch$/` from the issue

## Changes

- **Configuration**: Added `git branch` to the default auto-approved commands in `terminalChatAgentToolsConfiguration.ts`
- **Tests**: Updated test suite to verify `git branch` is properly auto-approved and recognized as a default rule

This change improves the user experience by eliminating unnecessary approval prompts for a safe, frequently-used git command while maintaining security for potentially dangerous operations.

<!-- START COPILOT CODING AGENT SUFFIX -->

Fixes microsoft/vscode#267226

title: welcome - fix bad `matches` implementation
body:
Having `matches` be dependent on a `selectedCategory` property is very risky because it is possible that initially multiple inputs are not considered equal but then later are.

@bhavyaus fyi, I saw a bug where 2 welcome editors were opened, both active in the editor group. I am not sure if this is a recent regression but `matches` cannot be depending on a property such as `selectedCategory` that only gets set later because then there is a chance that you can open multiple getting started inputs that later all select the same category and then are all considered equal. The editor group relies on a deterministic `matches` implementation that does not change later.

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
To optimize time and computer processing, it would be feasible to add the option to create tabbed workspaces, where each workspace would have its own files open for editing and the panel format saved. This would avoid having too many open windows, each with its own panel division, overloading Visual Studio's processing.
